Abstract: Brooklyn community groups drop their opposition to plan to move minor league Mets team into plannd ballpark in Flatbush, now that city has promised to renovate park where team would play; Brooklyn Boro Pres Howard Golden wants higher caliber ball club than Mets have offered, and he may be stumbling block to agreement; team would be put in Parade Grounds, adjacent to Prospect Park; deal to fix park will fall apart if Golden does not agree to drop his suit; coalition of community groups, including many critics of Mayor Rudolph W Giuliani, is pressuring Golden to drop his suit and endorse $12 million overhaul plan; map (M)
Snippet: Brooklyn community groups drop their opposition to plan to move minor league Mets team into plannd ballpark in Flatbush, now that city has promised to renovate park where team would play; Brooklyn Boro Pres Howard Golden wants higher caliber ball ...
LeadParagraph: A group of Brooklyn community groups that sued to stop a minor league Mets team from moving into a planned ballpark in Flatbush has dropped its opposition to the plan, now that the city has promised to renovate a park where the team would play.

Headline.Main: Brooklyn Groups Back Use Of Park by Mets Farm Team
Headline.PrintHeadline: Brooklyn Groups Back Use Of Park by Mets Farm Team
